history.text: Hello :)
Hi there!
Have you seen the movie Catch Me If You Can?
No i havent. what is it about
It's a true story about a guy, Frank Abagnale, who performs cons worth millions of dollars by posing as other people. Leo DiCaprio is plays Frank and does a very good job.
Tom Hanks and Christopher Walken are also in it.
wow, that sounds pretty interesting. so its a cops and robbers kind of movie almost then?
In a way. He plays all kinds of different occupations - a pilot, a doctor and a prosecutor - without any previous training or experience and gets away with it.
He's so good at it, he starts helping the FBI catch people like him.
so hes a genius who can take any identity he wants?
Pretty much. He is good at everything he does, too. If only...lol.
How long is the film? this doesn't seem like an hour and a half movie since the story is so detailed
I don't know how long it is but it was over 2 hours for sure. It was directed by Spielberg and his movies are usually longer than 90 minutes.
Oh ok i didnt know spielgerg made the film. yeah his stuff is normally pretty in depth
is there anything else interesting about the film you can tell me?
The Rotten Tomatoes score was 96% which is pretty high for any movie. And the CinemaScore was A- so it was well-received critically.
When Frank was still living at home with his mother, Frank posed as a substitute teacher in his French class.
damn he is a jack of all trades.
Then he ran away when his parents divorced. He impersonated a pilot after that and forged PanAm payroll checks and got away with 2.8 million dollars.
Yes, he was.
He does get put in prison for 12 years, though, since he's eventually caught.
does he get out after that and keep going. or does he stop?
After that the FBI starts using his services in exchange for the remainder of his sentence.
oh ok so he helped the FBI instead of doing all his jail time.
He does one more pilot scheme - because he misses it.
on a scale of 1 to 10 how would you rate this movie.
He did some jail time but approached the FBI to reduce his time and he would help him in exchange. Tom Hanks plays his FBI contact and partner.
Definitely a 10
yeah he seems like he made a fool of the FBI the entire movie from what it sounds.

At the end, the credits show Frank has been married for 26 years, has 3 sons, and is still good friends with the Tom Hanks character. And he's caught many forgers and earns millions a year because of his work creating unforgeable checks.
Yes, he did in a way but they were also smart enough to know how to use his talents.
so you think this is a KID friendly movie or just something adults should watch?
I would say more of a PG type movie. There's nothing bad in it but it does show the "villain" in a good light. But, smart kids will understand that.
I think im going to go out tonight and buy this movie and give it a shot.
It's really worth the time to see it. Great actors and director. Can't miss.
You won't be sorry.
ok thanks for the information.

uid1response.feedback: we talked about how leos character was able to do  all these different kind of things and travel everywhere for free and get paid to do so because he was an expert in frauding.
